summary: A series of confidential, emotionally raw journal entries from an individual describing experiences of abuse, coercion, and encounters with numerous powerful figures in the context of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's network. The entries detail traumatic events, forced travel, and interactions with wealthy and influential men.

persons.name: Mr. Glickman
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the author's mother lied about; now deceased.

persons.name: Mr. Robert
persons.context: Met at a huge house party with his wife Jill; same event where a British lady from Clearwater was present.

persons.name: Jill
persons.context: Described as the pretty wife of Mr. Robert, met at a party.

persons.name: Mary
persons.context: Implied to be someone the author wants to get away from; described as 'bat shit crazy' like the author's mom.

persons.name: Mr. Colgan
persons.context: Questioned why he agreed to something; listed among people associated with 'flights of horror'.

persons.name: Jeffrey
persons.context: Referenced as treating the author like 'special' property; associated with abusive situations and flights.

persons.name: Ghislaine
persons.context: Mentioned as being at work when needed; advised taking the author home due to Mr. Black's importance.

persons.name: Joe Gibbs
persons.context: Described as 'so nice' in contrast to others.

persons.name: Dan Snyder
persons.context: Described as a 'pig' and a 'red skin hoggett'; listed among people associated with 'flights of horror'.

persons.name: Mr. Dana
persons.context: Owned a plane the author was on that was described as scary; called 'disgusting' along with Larry Summers.

persons.name: Larry Summers
persons.context: Described as 'fucking disgusting' along with Mr. Dana.

persons.name: Tracy
persons.context: Mentioned in hope of having no relation to Larry Summers.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Compared to his brother in some negative way; context suggests inappropriate behavior.

persons.name: Mr. Mody
persons.context: Listed among men who 'are not who they say'; implied to be part of a dangerous network.

persons.context: Listed among men who 'are not who they say'; implied to be part of a dangerous network.

persons.name: Mr. Black
persons.context: Described as so important that Ghislaine prioritized him over the author's health; subject of a poem titled 'Stopped Dead'.

persons.name: Leon
persons.context: Told to 'go fuck himself' after an incident where the author was bitten.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Name appears as the title of a poem with underlined violent and demeaning words.

persons.context: Listed among people associated with 'flights of horror'.

persons.context: Listed among people associated with 'flights of horror'.

persons.name: Mr. Kimsey

connections.description: Both are central figures in the author's narrative of abuse and control; Ghislaine is depicted as working with/for Jeffrey.
Mr. Colgan is questioned for agreeing to something involving Jeffrey's treatment of the author.
Ghislaine prioritized Mr. Black's importance over the author's health, advising to take the author home.
Both are described together as 'fucking disgusting' in the context of a scary plane flight.
Andrew is compared to his brother in a negative context regarding behavior.
The author describes being treated like 'special' property by Jeffrey and references abuse.

events.title: Party at a huge house
events.description: The author attended a party at a huge house where they met Mr. Robert and his wife Jill, and encountered the same British lady from Clearwater.

events.title: Biting incident in New York
events.description: The author was bitten by a 'fat fuck' who threw them on the floor, causing blood on Jeffrey's carpet. The author was blamed and called dramatic.

events.title: Scary plane flight
events.description: The author was on a plane owned by Mr. Dana that was described as scary; both Mr. Dana and Larry Summers were called disgusting.

events.title: Forced photography and bets
events.description: The author questions why they have to take photos and references mysterious 'bets', expressing fear and confusion.

events.title: Flights of horror
events.description: The author describes repeated traumatic experiences on flights associated with Jeffrey and numerous other powerful men.

keyFacts: The author is a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, describing being treated as property and subjected to abuse.
The document lists numerous powerful men (e.g., Mr. Black, Mr. Dana, Larry Summers, George Mitchell) in the context of the abuse network, suggesting a wide circle of associates.
A violent incident is described where the author was bitten and thrown to the floor, then blamed for ruining a trip.
The author references forced photography, mysterious 'bets', and traumatic flights ('flights of horror') involving multiple high-profile individuals.
The tone is one of profound trauma, confusion, and betrayal, with the author feeling lost and manipulated by figures they expected to be good.
